data.title: Good experience
data.text: Went with my wife and friends. Everyone enjoyed the food. The service was pretty good - the staff was nice and attentive. We will probably be back.

data.title: Beautiful and tasty food
data.text: Second visit and both times my wife and I had an enjoyable meal. I have enjoyed many different Indian restaurants in this area and in a variety of states across the country and in England. The food quality matches or exceeds the other restaurants.

data.title: Excellent food. Server remembers me.
data.text: I've been here a few times since it's close to my work. Get an order of butter chicken! It's delicious! I've converted all my friends already. Our server (Phani) knows what I want now without having to ask after only coming a couple of visits. Great service, excellent food, never had to wait long. You can customize the level of "spicy" of any dish. My wife hates spicy and still loves to come here. Today they gave us a free dessert just because it's new. Love it!

data.title: Amazing!!!!!
data.text: Love coming here, I am here at least once a week for lunch and it is always brilliant. Phani is the greatest and is always an excellent host.

data.title: A quick getaway for delicious cuisine
data.text:
This place was awesome! The food was authentic. I had the Chicken Tiki Masala and my other half had the Chicken Curry. Mmmmm!!  
The atmosphere was pleasant and the staff was friendly. They were busy but then it was a Friday night and other sites gave them 5 star ratings.  Great place to go for Indian food. Highly recommend it.

data.title: Good lunch specials
data.text: This place is just like in India, where they kind of throw your water at you, and it miraculously doesn't fall over everywhere. Their food is tasty, too. I'm a vegetarian, and they have some vegetarian specials, but it's also great for meat dishes. They seem to rush people through the ordering process, but the food is delicious.

data.title: Nice cuisine and plenty to eat
data.text:
We went with another couple who wanted vegan dishes and found several that worked well. The Aloo Gobi was good as was the Mattar Mushroom dish that was vegan. We also ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo, both excellent. When you order they ask how spicy you want it so they cater to your preferences. That's nice. 

We also ordered naan twice, once as an appetizer with some vegetable samosa. All of it was delicious. We ordered more naan about halfway through and didn't get it for a long time. We had to ask about it three times and finally got it near the end of our meal. We weren't sure what the mix up was. Otherwise, the service was great.

This was our first time here and we will, most likely, eat there again.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: The best ever Indian food in the Utah valley. Their dishes are made with perfect blender of spices and atmosphere is perfect  with fine arts which is an adorning one.

data.title: Amazing Indian food!
data.text: We love this restaurant! We are here at least twice a month and almost always bring friends. Our good friend who lived in India said it was the most authentic Indian food she'd had here in Orem. My husband loves all the curries. I have tried many things on  the menu and love everything, with a delicious side of naan.

data.title: Good food. Great value.
data.text: I frequent this place with work friends. Service is very quick. Food is great. In the under-ten-bucks lunch category, it's near the top.

data.title: Food is average, service is poor
data.text:
Food wasn't bad, but nothing to write much about. Not a lot of flavor.  The poor service is what warrants the average rating.

The place wasn't even that busy, but the waiter acted as if we were an imposition upon his time.

data.title: Different but tastey.
data.text: It was my first time there. Didn't know what to expect. The people who worked there were awesome. When I got my food, the anxiety was over. The food was much better than I thought. I gotta go back and try new menu items. Fun stuff.

data.title: Love the food, hate the service
data.text: This is our favorite Indian food in the county, but it's hard to want to go because the service is always extremely subpar

data.title: Whoa, no go!!
data.text: First off, not sure if someone just dropped an atomic bomb in the restroom or if there is a serious sewer problem. Second, do not bring kids here not kid friendly at all. We came with a group of 7 adults and 4 kids(not recommended for groups greater than 6) The server seemed put off by our group size and the kids. He also seemed put off by us wanting to split the check 3 ways. The food tastes good, so if you don't mind poor service, the smell of poop while you eat, and the wonder what happens in that kitchen when the service poor and they allow the smell this could be a great place for you. Personally, I'd prefer to dine at other local Indian cuisine restaurant's that appreciate your business.

data.title: Great food - Great value
data.text: We were seated quickly and politely.  It was Saturday evening so the place was busy.  They took our order right away for the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Chicken Coconut Kurma, Naan bread, and Mango Lassi.  The food came soon, hot and fresh, and plenty for us.  Everything was delicious.  The price was very reasonable--about $40 including tip.  The room was clean, comfortable and well lit.  We've been here several times before and never been disappointed.   We've written some pretty critical reviews for other restaurants, but it's hard to find anything to complain about here.

data.title: Suprisingly good!
data.text: Not a big fan of Indian food but this turned out great.  We ordered several different chicken curries to share with our rice. All were good but I especially liked the chicken pineapple curry.  It was difficult to distinguish one from another based on visuals alone but each had a distinctive flavor.  Basmati rice was excellent.

data.title: Excellent Tikka Masala
data.text: We go here about as often as Bombay House, and more often than many other Indian restaurants. The Masala here is delicious, and the decor and atmosphere inside are really  pleasant. It is never too crowded, and one of our favorite spots in Orem. Slightly cheaper than similar restaurants, well worth what you pay.

data.title: Best Indian food ever!
data.text: The most delicious Indian food I've had in my life! Phani is the kindest waiter I have ever met in a restaurant. He remembers faces and has great manners. The food is phenomenal, the chicken coconut korma is by far my favorite, and a close second is the tikka masala. Naan is fresh and fluffy, charred perfectly. I've been here six times and I will continue to go until I can't anymore!!

data.title: Solid Indian food
data.text: I love Indian food! This place has good Indian food, but not great Indian food. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The atmosphere is ok. The value is good for what you get. If I'm really craving good Indian food I drive a little further, but this place is good for a quick lunch or dinner.

data.title: Excellent Indian menu
data.text: Everything is good. Have been here several times and never disappointed. We go for the lunch s.pecials
